flixel.plugin.TweenManager

type
class
extends
FlxPlugin
A manager for FlxTweens.

Constructor

new()

Instance Variables hide inherited show inherited

ID : Int

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
IDs seem like they could be pretty useful, huh? They're not actually used for anything yet though.

active(default,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Controls whether update() is automatically called by FlxState/FlxGroup.

alive(default,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Useful state for many game objects - "dead" (!alive) vs alive. kill() and revive() both flip this switch (along with exists, but you can override that).

cameras : Array<FlxCamera>

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
An array of camera objects that this object will use during draw(). This value will initialize itself during the first draw to automatically point at the main camera list out in FlxG unless you already set it. You can also change it afterward too, very flexible!

collisionType : flixel.system.FlxCollisionType

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic

exists(default,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
This flag indicates whether this objects has been destroyed or not. Cannot be set, use destroy() and revive().

ignoreDrawDebug : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Setting this to true will prevent the object from appearing when the visual debug mode in the debugger overlay is toggled on.

list(default,null) : Array<flixel.tweens.FlxTween>

A list of all FlxTween objects.

visible(default,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Controls whether draw() is automatically called by FlxState/FlxGroup.

Instance Methods hide inherited show inherited

add(Tween : flixel.tweens.FlxTween, ?Start : Bool) : flixel.tweens.FlxTween

parameters
Tween The FlxTween to add.
Start Whether you want it to start right away.
returns
The added FlxTween object.
Add a FlxTween.

clear(?Destroy : Bool) : Void

parameters
Destroy Whether you want to destroy the FlxTweens.
Removes all FlxTweens.

destroy() : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
WARNING: This will remove this object entirely. Use kill() if you want to disable it temporarily only and revive() it later. Override this function to null out variables manually or call destroy() on class members if necessary. Don't forget to call super.destroy()!

draw() : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Override this function to control how the object is drawn. Overriding draw() is rarely necessary, but can be very useful.

drawDebug() : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic

drawDebugOnCamera(?Camera : FlxCamera) : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
parameters
Camera Which camera to draw the debug visuals to.
Override this function to draw custom "debug mode" graphics to the specified camera while the debugger's visual mode is toggled on.

kill() : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Handy function for "killing" game objects. Use reset() to revive them. Default behavior is to flag them as nonexistent AND dead. However, if you want the "corpse" to remain in the game, like to animate an effect or whatever, you should override this, setting only alive to false, and leaving exists true.

onResize(Width : Int, Height : Int) : Void

inherited from flixel.plugin.FlxPlugin
parameters
Width The new window width
Height The new window Height
This function is called whenever the window size has been changed.

inline onStateSwitch() : Void

overrides flixel.plugin.FlxPlugin

remove(Tween : flixel.tweens.FlxTween, ?Destroy : Bool) : flixel.tweens.FlxTween

parameters
Tween The FlxTween to remove.
Destroy Whether you want to destroy the FlxTween.
returns
The added FlxTween object.
Remove a FlxTween.

revive() : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Handy function for bringing game objects "back to life". Just sets alive and exists back to true. In practice, this function is most often called by FlxObject.reset().

toString() : String

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Convert object to readable string name. Useful for debugging, save games, etc.

update() : Void

overrides flixel.FlxBasic
